text: (bright music)
- As the leader of a growing business,

you want your infrastructure
to be infinitely scalable
and available coast to coast.

You want to make sure it
delivers the best performance
at the lowest price point.
That's why the AWS Cloud
is designed to help you optimize costs,

but not compromise on
availability and performance.

This means you can focus
less on operating expenses
and more on expanding your business
and innovating for customers.

Here's why the AWS Cloud
is so cost efficient.

Instead of buying, owning and
maintaining physical servers,
you can access technology,

such as computing power,
storage and databases,
on an as needed basis from AWS.
Your business can save money

by removing the burden
of manually provisioning

and maintaining
infrastructure at any scale.
With the AWS Cloud,
you can add resources when you need them
and remove them when you don't.
For example, when your peak season ends

and customer demand
slows, you can manually

or automatically terminate
unused resources.

You can add more resources
when demand surges,
such as when you launch a new product,

expand to a new region or
whatever your use case may be.
This scaling can be done automatically.

AWS Auto Scaling monitors the
demand on your application
and automatically adjusts capacity
to maintain steady predictable performance
at the lowest possible cost.

You can set up Auto Scaling
to scale multiple resources
across multiple services in minutes
and it provides recommendations
to optimize performance and costs
or balance between the two.

Even when optimizing your
infrastructure automatically,

you may want your team to
look at infrastructure costs
and make their own assessments.
They can do that with AWS Cost Explorer.
You can use AWS Cost Explorer
to visualize expenses over time
to gain a deeper understanding
of your business's trends as they happen.
The beauty of the AWS Cloud

is that it works the same
way with 10,000 users
as it does with 100 million users.

With AWS, your team
doesn't have to reevaluate

your infrastructure decisions
every year as you grow.
AWS is designed to help you optimize
both performance and cost
so you can drive more business innovation.

Make sure your team understands
AWS cost optimization
and architecture

so they can make the best
decisions for your business.
Have your team take official AWS training
linked in the description of this video.
